snippet: The grandly named Syrian Observatory for Human Rights is virtually a one-man band, run by Rami Abdul Rahman from a drab city in Britain.
abstract: Rami Abdul Rahman, founder of the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, runs organization himself out of house in Coventry, England, after fleeing Syria in 2000; is frequently contacted by news agencies for his expertise on progression of war; says his ultimate goal is to hold accountable those responsible for Syria's destruction.
lead_paragraph: The grandly named Syrian Observatory for Human Rights is virtually a one-man band, run by Rami Abdul Rahman from a drab city in Britain.

headline.seo: Rami Abdul Rahman’s Syrian Observatory for Human Rights
headline.main: A Very Busy Man Behind the Syrian Civil War’s Casualty Count
headline.print_headline: A Very Busy Man Behind the Syrian Civil War’s Casualty Count
